item.title: Coloring emoji/unicode characters on iOS Safari
item.description: Unicode characters such as ■ (black square U+25A0) can be super useful to use for icons without needing to load an icon font. And they can typically be styled using CSS, like: color: steelblue;. But on iOS safari (and likely Android and other devices), these are rendered in the cartooney, emoji style — which means trying to color them with CSS doesn’t work. Fortunately there is an easy (but cryptic) fix: Simply append &#xFE0E; immediately following your unicode character, like ■&#xFE0E;.
